noun.description: A postage stamp that has been cancelled prior to being used on an item of mail, often to facilitate bulk mailing.

verb.description: Philately. To cancel (a postage stamp) by means of a frank ahead of its use, often to facilitate bulk mailing.
To cancel beforehand; to cancel giving prior notice.

origin: Early 20th century. Apparently shortened from precancellation, probably originally as a graphic abbreviation<br>early 20th century; earliest use found in Conditions Use of Precanceled Postage Stamps. From pre- + cancel.
